critique: The document is an executive order issued by President George W. Bush in 2001, addressing the situation in the Western Balkans. It declares a national emergency due to actions threatening peace and stability in the region and authorizes sanctions against individuals involved in extremist violence or obstructing the implementation of peace agreements. The order invokes the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) and directs the Secretary of the Treasury to take necessary actions to carry out the order's purposes.
